greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the norm of divisors of n over Eisenstein integers, with associated divisors counted only once.
comment: Equivalent of sigma (A000203) in the ring of Eisenstein integers. Note that only norms are summed up.
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(3^e) = sigma(3^(2e)) = (3^(2e+1) - 1)/2, a(p^e) = sigma(p^e)^2 = ((p^(e+1) - 1)/(p - 1))^2 if p == 1 (mod 3) and sigma_2(p^e) = A001157(p^e) = (p^(2e+2) - 1)/(p^2 - 1) if p == 2 (mod 3).
example: Let w = (1 + sqrt(3)*i)/2, w' = (1 - sqrt(3)*i)/2, and ||d|| denote the norm of d.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := If[p == 3 , DivisorSigma[1, 3^(2*e)], Switch[Mod[p, 3], 1, DivisorSigma[1, p^e]^2, 2, DivisorSigma[2, p^e]]]; eisSigma[1] = 1; eisSigma[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[eisSigma, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 10 2020 *)
xref: Equivalent of arithmetic functions in the ring of Eisenstein integers (the corresponding functions in the ring of integers are in the parentheses): A319442 ("d", A000005), this sequence ("sigma", A000203), A319445 ("phi", A000010), A319446 ("psi", A002322), A319443 ("omega", A001221), A319444 ("Omega", A001222), A319448 ("mu", A008683).
Equivalent in the ring of Gaussian integers: A317797.
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Sep 19 2018
